page.title: 15EDUCATION IN ABINGTON
page.content: Adjacent to the school is the play- group where two supervisors and one voluntary helper cater for up to 20 children aged 3 to 5 years five morn- ings a week 9.15am-noon. The children do project and creative activities and constructive play. Their equipment in- cludes paints, sand, playdough, wood and water.They are encouraged to write their own name and have simple work- books to help them recognise shapes, colours, sorting and matching. Abington Primary School has 4 classes for children aged 5-11. The children attend every day from 8.50am to 3.15 pm. There are 4 teachers and 99 child- ren. Usually school starts with ass- embly. All classes do English and mathematics in the mornings. After lunch the two younger classes have free activity and the upper classes have activities, such as sports and
